DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the surgical procedure that was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to executed and carried through to completion the use of an operative procedure on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others.: (or-kee-EK-toe-mee) Surgery to remove one or both testicles.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.
Surgical removal of one or both testicles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

PermissibleValues.value: Unilateral retroperitoneal lymph node dissection and orchiectomy
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Retroperitoneal Regional Lymph Node Dissection And Orchiectomy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Retroperitoneal Regional Lymph Node Dissection And Orchiectomy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (RET-row-PAIR-ih-toe-NEE-ul) Having to do with the area outside or behind the peritoneum (the tissue that lines the abdominal wall and covers most of the organs in the abdomen).: Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in a particular anatomic region. This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: (or-kee-EK-toe-mee) Surgery to remove one or both testicles.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in, or located in the retroperitoneum.
Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in a particular anatomic region.  This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Surgical removal of one or both testicles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of as much of a malignant tumor as is reasonably possible. This procedure increases the effectiveness of the subsequent administration of chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of as much of a malignant tumor as is reasonably possible. This procedure increases the effectiveness of the subsequent administration of chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.: Removal or excision by surgical measures.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others.: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical creation of an opening of the skull.

Concepts.definition: Surgical creation of an opening of the skull.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An X-ray procedure using multiple coordinates to precisely determine the location of a tumor or nodule so as to obtain a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A biopsy procedure that uses 3-dimensional imaging to localize a lesion and guide the removal of a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.: Two masses of lymphatic tissue located one on either side of the oropharynx in the oropharyngeal isthmus.: Surgical removal of the tonsils.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
Two masses of lymphatic tissue located one on either side of the oropharynx in the oropharyngeal isthmus.
Surgical removal of the tonsils.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involving only one part or side.: Two masses of lymphatic tissue located one on either side of the oropharynx in the oropharyngeal isthmus.: Surgical removal of the tonsils.

Concepts.definition: Involving only one part or side.
Two masses of lymphatic tissue located one on either side of the oropharynx in the oropharyngeal isthmus.
Surgical removal of the tonsils.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A procedure to remove or repair a part of the body or to find out whether disease is present. An operation.
